DOC.HEAD: Hidden Gifts Thrown Out with the Trash
DOC.TEXT: Jennifer Rachman thought a box of bulging trash bags would be a good place to hide presents for her family. Her husband thought the box should go out with the trash. The box, concealing luggage for her husband and a TV set for her 8-year-old son Jake, was gone for two hours Wednesday before Mrs. Rachman found out. A frantic call went out to BZ Disposal. ``They were sorry, but they said there was absolutely no chance I could find my box,'' Mrs. Rachman recalled. ``They said by then it was buried under tons and tons of garbage. I called the dump, and they said the same thing. Then I sat down and cried for two hours.'' But she underestimated the disposal company. Truck driver Genaro Duran was curious about the box and set it aside. Later he found the gifts and, figuring some thief had dumped loot, told a supervisor, Manuel Sarinana. The supervisor took the box to the company office and there someone remembered Mrs. Rachman's telephone call. ``It was,'' Mrs. Rachman said, ``my little miracle.''
